channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: The man who helped roll back abortion rights now wants to "crush liberal dominance"
item.description: Leonard Leo of the Federalist Society helped overturn abortion rights. He spoke to Morning Edition about his plans to disrupt Hollywood, Silicon Valley and other perceived centers of liberal thinking through the Teneo Network.
item.content:encoded:
Leonard Leo of the Federalist Society helped overturn abortion rights. He spoke to Morning Edition about his plans to disrupt Hollywood, Silicon Valley and other perceived centers of liberal thinking through the Teneo Network.

(Image credit: Carolyn Kaster/AP)
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: After 15 years, Megan Atherton reunites with her 'Unsung Hero'
item.description: A special reunion conversation between Megan Atherton and the woman who changed the course of her life.
item.content:encoded:
Unsung Hero.'/>

A special reunion conversation between Megan Atherton and the woman who changed the course of her life.

(Image credit: Megan Atherton)
item.dc:creator: Autumn Barnes

item.title: Plastic waste is everywhere. Countries have one more chance to agree on a solution
item.description: Negotiations over a U.N. treaty to cut plastics have been bogged down. Environmental groups blame the oil and gas industry.
item.content:encoded:
Negotiations over a U.N. treaty to cut plastics have been bogged down. Environmental groups blame the oil and gas industry.

(Image credit: Christopher Furlong)
item.dc:creator: Michael Copley

item.title: Romania in shock after far-right populist enters presidential election's runoff
item.description: Romania's political landscape is reeling after a little-known, far-right populist secured the first round in the presidential election, going from an obscure candidate to beating the incumbent prime minister.
item.content:encoded:
Romania's political landscape is reeling after a little-known, far-right populist secured the first round in the presidential election, going from an obscure candidate to beating the incumbent prime minister.

(Image credit: Alexandru Dobre)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: The holidays are stressful. Restore your calm with these 5 quick tricks
item.description: Keep these science-backed stress busters in your back pocket this holiday season. Whip 'em out the next time you're at a table full of bickering in-laws or your flight gets canceled!
item.content:encoded:
Keep these science-backed stress busters in your back pocket this holiday season. Whip 'em out the next time you're at a table full of bickering in-laws or your flight gets canceled!

(Image credit: Dima Berlin)
item.dc:creator: Marielle Segarra

item.title: The history of one of Washington's weirdest traditions: the turkey pardon
item.description: The history of the presidential turkey pardon is often misremembered. Here are the fowl facts.
item.content:encoded:
The history of the presidential turkey pardon is often misremembered. Here are the fowl facts.

(Image credit: Andrew Caballero-Reynolds)
item.dc:creator: Domenico Montanaro

item.title: You can reduce your risk of dementia. Here's how to get started
item.description: About 40% of dementia cases could be prevented or delayed by healthy lifestyle choices and preventive medicine. Here's a tool to gauge your brain care and track your progress.
item.content:encoded:
About 40% of dementia cases could be prevented or delayed by healthy lifestyle choices and preventive medicine. Here's a tool to gauge your brain care and track your progress.

(Image credit: MirageC)
item.dc:creator: Allison Aubrey

item.title: Adultery is no longer illegal in New York
item.description: It was considered a Class B misdemeanor, which carries a jail sentence of up to three months.
item.content:encoded:
It was considered a Class B misdemeanor, which carries a jail sentence of up to three months.

(Image credit: Angela Weiss)
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie

item.title: Foreign ministers meet in Italy for the last G7 of the Biden administration
item.description: Foreign ministers from the world's leading industrialized nations are meeting Monday, with a certain pressure to advance diplomatic efforts ahead of the new U.S. administration taking over.
item.content:encoded:
Foreign ministers from the world's leading industrialized nations are meeting Monday, with a certain pressure to advance diplomatic efforts ahead of the new U.S. administration taking over.

(Image credit: Andrew Medichini)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
